text:
Champions League
OL: Leipzig wins against Zenith and allows Lyon to hope!
Julian Nagelsmann's men won in Russia 2-0 and allowed Olympique Lyonnais to believe in second place.
05 Nov 2019, 19:51 by Rafael Da Silva



Jeff Reine-Adela√ØdeClub Previous: Angers SCOIndemnity: 25 Million EurosIcon Sport



Joachim AndersenClub previous: SampdoriaIndemnity: 24 million eurosIcon Sport



Thiago MendesClub previous: Lille OSCIndemnity: 22 million eurosIcon Sport



Youssouf Kon√©Club previous: Lille OSCIndemnity: 9 million eurosIcon Sport



Jean LucasClub previous: FlamengoIndemnity: 8 million eurosIcon Sport



Ciprian TatarusanuClub previous: FC NantesIndemnity: noneIcon Sport



Boubacar FofanaClub previous: Gaz√©lec AjaccioIndemnity: noneIcon Sport

OL: all the rookies of the 2019 transfer window




This Tuesday night, the Champions League is on the program. And one of the first two games of the evening at 18:55 staged the Zenith Saint-Petersburg and Leipzig, two of the three opponents of Olympique Lyonnais in the pool phase.
And it was finally the Germans who won. Diego Demme allowed his team to lead just before halftime (45 + 5 '), before Marcel Sabitzer (63') scored the second and final goal of his own. With this success 2-0, Leipzig confirms its first place in this group. And allows Olympique Lyonnais to climb to second place in difference of goal before its meeting against Benfica!




The provisional classification:




Julian Nagelsmann makes a start to the season + 7 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport


1. Leipzig - 9 points (+2)
2. OL - 4 points (+1)
3. Zenith - 4 points (-1)
4. Benfica - 3 points (-2)
